docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: COMPANIES Putting Ivan Boesky on Trial The Mulheren trial is turning into the Boesky trial. Ivan F. Boesky was forced to testify last week that he kept millions in profits from insider trading, took a tax deduction for half of his $100 million settlement and illegally paid other prisoners to do his laundry.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Kirk Dressendorfer was in the trainer's room again. Last weekend, as he approached the most significant moments of his third and presumably final season as a pitcher for the University of Texas, Dressendorfer had become a regular occupant of the trainer's room and doctor's offices.

headline.main: THE TENDER YEARS AND SORE ARMS

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The Exxon Corporation oil-cleaners are back on the beaches of Prince William Sound, amid continuing disagreement about the extent of damage to the sea and the shoreline from the nation's worst oil spill.

headline.main: In Alaska, New Season Of Cleanup (and Debate)

docs.snippet: LEAD: The Exxon Corporation oil-cleaners are back on the beaches of Prince William Sound, amid continuing disagreement about the extent of damage to the sea and the shoreline from the nation's worst oil spill.

byline.original: By TIMOTHY EGAN, Special to The New York Times
